Instruction: Combine the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl until evenly mixed.
Knead the dough softly and shape into a 1 1/2-inch thick circle on a floured surface. Cut into quarters and gently pat each piece to shape.

The wedges are then cooked on the preheated griddle until each side is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, typically about 15 minutes per side. After cooking, place the wedges on a wire rack to cool. Finally, cut each wedge in half and slice horizontally before serving.
